channel.title: whonix internal ip subnet (eg 10.152.152.52) change ?
channel.description: I use a normal browser on another operating system routed through whonix gateway, with WebRTC enabled, thus exposing the internal IP which is on subnet 10.152.152.** . I want to change it to 192.168.1.1 as default. since this is most used worldwide. Is there an easy way for this ? Thanks.

item.title: whonix internal ip subnet (eg 10.152.152.52) change ?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
One can’t make everyone happy.

It’s 10.152 now because was a discussion earlier to change the opposite direction. From 192 to something else. 192 generates too much FUD. Also to avoid conflicts with routers, even though unlikely. Was very painful to change. Now it’s considered an anti leak feature.

Read full topic

item.title: whonix internal ip subnet (eg 10.152.152.52) change ?
item.dc:creator: user8765
item.description:
but why this change, old whonix used to have 192.168.*.**. all the statistics show that this IP is the most used worldwide.

Read full topic

I use a normal browser on another operating system routed through whonix gateway, with WebRTC enabled, thus exposing the internal IP which is on subnet 10.152.152.** .
I want to change it to 192.168.1.1 as default. since this is most used worldwide. Is there an easy way for this ?
Thanks.
